name: Switcher-js
body:
switcher-js ===========
![ON](http://i.imgur.com/LZpVo.png) ![OFF](http://i.imgur.com/2Q2a6.png)
Simulate your own on and off switch button with this simple plugin. ===========

Usage

***
Html
Simply add an radio button on your page like this: ``
Javascript
And then call the plugin in your ``: `$(document).ready(function(){ $("#switch").switcher(); })`

Tips

*** 1. It works like a real radio button, when it's turned off, it doesn't returns value on a submitted form.

Contribution

*** Want to help? Choose one new feature in the new features list, ask me about the task, create a branch and be my guest.

New feature list

*** * Ajax support. * Two-option of CSS. * Create option to change status text (it's not so simple ;) ).
